III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/16/25, while traveling back to the facility from an event, one
youth assaulted another youth and a physical altercation ensued
between both youths. One youth was arrested.
Investigation Interviews
Attempts to interview Complainant by phone were made on
05/21/2025 and 06/11/2025. A return call was not received.
Youth A was interviewed on 05/22/2025 at Christ Child House.
Youth A stated at the start of the interview that he did not want to
be interviewed, but agreed to answer a few questions. Youth A
stated a staff (did not want to disclose who) took him, Youth B and
Youth C to Comic Con. Youth A stated this staff called law
enforcement after they left the event and Youth B got arrested.
Youth A stated he was not injured in this incident and did not want
to roll up his pants for his ankles and knees to determine if there
was injury. Youth A stated he had no concerns about the incident
and stated he was tricked to answer questions. Youth A’s
interview was concluded.
Youth B was interviewed on 05/22/2025 at Christ Child House.
Youth B stated Coordinator took him, Youth A and Youth C to
Comic Con. Youth B stated there were no issues during Comic
Con but Youth A and Youth C started to argue about looking at
girls and their families when they left Comic Con and walked to
the van. Youth B stated Coordinator sat in the driver seat, Youth B
sat in the front passenger seat, Youth C sat directly behind the
driver seat and Youth A sat in the third-row seat behind the front
passenger seat. Youth B stated Youth C threatened to “beat up”
Youth A and climbed over the van seats to get to Youth A. Youth
B stated Youth A pushed, punched, and held Youth C down by his
arms on the middle row van seat. Youth B stated law enforcement
arrived and Youth C tried to pull Youth A out of the van with him.
Youth B stated Youth C tried to attack law enforcement and law
2

enforcement cuffed Youth C and placed Youth C in the back of a
police car. Youth B stated Coordinator drove Youth A and Youth B
back to Christ Child House. Youth B was asked about
Coordinator’s actions during this incident. Youth B stated
Coordinator directed Youth A and Youth C to “chill out” but did not
physically intervene with Youth A or Youth C.
Youth C was interviewed on 05/30/2025 at Christ Child House.
Youth C stated there was an incident at Comic Con, but he did not
want to talk about it. Youth C was asked about Coordinator’s
actions during the incident. Youth C stated he threatened to fight
Youth A when they were in the van and Coordinator told him that
she would call law enforcement if they fought. Youth C stated he
did not want to continue the interview. Youth C stated he did not
have concerns with Coordinator and stated Coordinator is like a
“momma” figure to him. No further questions were asked of Youth
C.
Coordinator was interviewed on 05/30/2025 at Christ Child
House. Coordinator stated Youth A, Youth B and Youth C were
selected to attend Comic Con due to their positive behavior.
Coordinator stated the outing went well until they headed out to
eat dinner. Coordinator stated Youth A and Youth C started to
bicker on the walk back to the van. Coordinator stated she sat in
the driver seat, Youth B sat in the front passenger seat and she
directed Youth A and Youth C to seat themselves separately.
Coordinator stated Youth C sat in the front row and threatened to
fight Youth A, who sat in the third row of the van. Coordinator
stated Youth C did a “spider monkey move” and went back to
Youth A’s seat and swung without connecting with Youth A.
Coordinator stated Youth A climbed to the middle row in the van,
told Youth C to “calm down”, and held Youth C down by his arms.
Coordinator stated she verbally redirected Youth A and Youth C to
separate and called 911 because she could not physically
manage the youths alone. Coordinator stated Youth A let go of
Youth C when law enforcement arrived. Coordinator stated Youth
C got out of the van and went towards Youth A, who was still in
the van. Coordinator stated Youth C swung at Youth A, but hit the
law enforcement officer behind him when he pulled his arm back
to swing. Coordinator stated paramedics arrived and evaluated
Youth A’s leg for minor scratches. Coordinator stated law
enforcement placed Youth C in handcuffs and Youth C kicked the
patrol car before getting in. Coordinator stated she drove Youth A
and Youth B back to Christ Child House and law enforcement took
Youth C.
3

Documentation
Coordinator wrote an incident report dated 05/16/2025. The
incident report coincides with her interview.
Youth A was evaluated at Christ Child House on 05/21/2025 and
denied pain and injury.
Coordinator completed Nonviolent Crisis Prevention Institute
training on 08/28/2024. Coordinator has a discipline history for
pushing and secluding a youth in 08/2024.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance in providing for the needs,
protection and supervision of Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C
when Coordinator attempted to verbally redirect and called
emergency services on 05/16/2025 when Youth A and Youth C
physically engaged in the van while off grounds on an outing.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4103 Space and equipment requirements.
Section An institution shall provide all of the following to assure delivery of
Description licensed services: Sufficient resident living space, as set forth in R
400.4150. Office space. Equipment to assure delivery of licensed
services.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Christ Child House did not have working phones on 05/16/2025
causing Youth C to remain at Oakland County Children’s Village
until 05/18/2025.
Investigation Interviews
Another Department of Health and Human Service (DHHS)
Worker was interviewed on 06/03/2025 by phone. DHHS Worker
stated Christ Child House notified Youth C’s Foster Care Worker
on Friday, 05/16/2025 by email that Youth C was picked up by law
enforcement for domestic violence. DHHS Worker stated Youth
C’s Guardian Ad Litem contacted her on Sunday, 05/18/2025
about Youth C and DHHS Worker facilitated Youth C’s return to
Christ Child House on 05/18/2025.
Chief administrator was interviewed on 07/02/2025 at Christ
Child House. Chief Administrator stated Youth C would have
returned to Christ Child House on 05/16/2025 if law enforcement
was able to establish contact with them. Chief Administrator stated
4

Christ Child House’s phones were unknowingly not working on
05/16/2025.
Documentation
Law enforcement report dated 05/16/2025 was reviewed. Report
states Youth C was arrested for domestic violence on 05/16/2025.
Report states law enforcement was unable to reach anyone at
Christ Child House because the phone rang continuously without
answer and there was no prompt to leave a voicemail message.
Report states a referee directed Youth C’s placement at Oakland
County Children’s Village due to a lack of contact with Christ Child
House.
Christ Child House’s email correspondence dated 06/11/2025 with
Department of Health and Human Services contract department
was reviewed. Email states some of Christ Child House’s phones
were found not ringing on Saturday, 05/17/2025. Christ Child
House contacted their managed information technology company
on Monday, 05/19/2025 for repair because the company is closed
on weekends. Christ Child House’s phones were fixed and in
working order on 05/19/2025. In addition, Christ Child House
ordered two portable phones and these were operationalized on
05/22/2025 to ensure working phones are available at all times.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance because Christ Child House
took immediate action to remedy the nonworking phones and
added two portable phones to ensure that phones are available at
all times. Christ Child House did not plan for Youth C’s temporary
replacement.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
5

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
